forensique.title: Forensic
forensique.contentText: Solid knowledge of the basic principles of computer forensics, including methods of data acquisition, data analysis and presentation of evidence.

devsecops.title: DevSecOps
devsecops.contentText: Strong understanding of development, IT security and regulatory compliance. Skilled in CI/CD, network security, penetration testing.

pentesting.title: Pentesting
pentesting.contentText: Penetration testing and common vulnerabilities. Reconnaissance, exploitation, post-exploitation and reporting. Identification and correction of vulnerabilities to ensure the security of systems and networks.

developpement.title: Development
developpement.contentText: Expertise in Java, Python, C++, JavaScript, Bash, Docker and others. Advanced use of Github for version control and collaboration on personal and professional projects.

aboutMePage.title: ABOUT ME
aboutMePage.paragraph_one: I completed the Cybersecurity course organized by HackerU in cooperation with the University of Warsaw, the course included the modules Linux Fundamentals, Windows Server 2016, Bypassing the Perimeter, SIEM & SOC, Cross Platform Elevation of Privileges, Advanced Infrastructure, Python for Hacking, Web Fundamentals, Web Application Penetration Testing, Mobile Security and OSCP Preparation.
aboutMePage.paragraph_two: I use VirtualBox and Proxmox virtualizers. I can write simple scripts with the extension .ps1 .sh .py .html .css .js .php. I am also familiar with the basis of network protocols, e-mail and encryption (wiresharka, airmon-ng, ARP Spoofing, scapy in python, nmap, some of the tools that use network protocols)
aboutMePage.paragraph_three: I devote every free moment to learning cybersecurity, learning the methods used by hackers and security - I graduated from The Advent of Cyber 2021 at tryhackme.com.
